title: Samsung Washer OE Error Code: Causes and Fixes
symptom: Washer stops cycle and shows OE.
causes: Intermittent washer sensor reading outside expected range.
Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core washer subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your washer and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core dryer subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).

steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your dryer and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core dishwasher subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your dishwasher and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

causes: Intermittent ac sensor reading outside expected range.
Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core ac subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your ac and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core refrigerator subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your refrigerator and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

causes: Intermittent dishwasher sensor reading outside expected range.
Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core dishwasher subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your dishwasher and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.

causes: Intermittent dryer sensor reading outside expected range.
Temporary power-state mismatch after a surge or abrupt cycle interruption.
Mechanical restriction in a core dryer subsystem (airflow, drain, or movement).
Wiring harness connection seated loosely due to vibration over time.
steps: Power-cycle the unit for 3 minutes, then restart a short test cycle.
Inspect accessible filters, vents, or drains specific to your dryer and clear debris.
Confirm the appliance is level and stable to avoid false sensor triggers.
Run one empty maintenance cycle and observe whether the code returns.
If repeated, inspect harness connections and service documentation for continuity checks.
preventiveTips: Run monthly maintenance cycles and clean filters on schedule.
Avoid overloading and keep installation clearances within manufacturer guidance.
Use surge protection where local power quality is inconsistent.
whenToStop: Stop and call a licensed technician if the code reappears after two full restart attempts or if you detect heat, smoke, or water leakage.
